sentences.english: Interior is very attractive, living room with arched roof, leaded glass windows.
sentences.chinese: 內部非常誘人，客廳有拱形屋頂，鉛玻璃窗戶。

sentences.english: The fruit cake has tantalized the world for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 幾個世紀以來，水果蛋糕都是誘人的美味。

sentences.english: Lisette 's large red mouth broke into a most alluring smile.
sentences.chinese: 莉莎特的鮮紅的大嘴露出了一副極爲誘人的微笑。

sentences.english: Install behind, was beautiful and charming and add seductive charm.
sentences.chinese: 成裝上身後，既漂亮嫵媚，又倍添誘人魅力。

sentences.english: The new technology is irresistible and the market is enormous.
sentences.chinese: 這項新技術是誘人的，而且有很大的市場。

sentences.english: As he looked out, a fantastic smell came to his nose.
sentences.chinese: 當他伸出頭時，一股誘人的香味撲鼻而來。

sentences.english: Research of Video Watermarking Based on DSP;
sentences.chinese: 數字視頻產品帶有很多誘人的功能。

sentences.english: That all sounds especially alluring in a recession.
sentences.chinese: 這些在如今經濟衰退時聽起來都相當誘人。

sentences.english: A slight char is also apparent, creating a very enticing aroma.
sentences.chinese: 一種輕微的焦糊味創造了誘人的香味。

sentences.english: An attractive, nutritious breakfast fit for a queen.
sentences.chinese: 好一份適合女王享用而誘人的營養早餐。

sentences.english: These hydrolysates yielded the meaty flavoring necessary to make these rapid-cooking soups, meaty and so enticing.
sentences.chinese: 這類水解物提供了肉的風味使湯料很誘人。

sentences.english: Soft skin, red lips, so kissable.
sentences.chinese: 柔軟的皮膚，紅色的嘴脣，誘人親吻。

sentences.english: I think this is the most desirable of the compact cars.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這款車型是緊湊型車中最誘人的一款。

sentences.english: But Rusal also has its attractions.
sentences.chinese: 但俄鋁也有其誘人之處。

sentences.english: We like Shao Xing rice wine because it tastes good.
sentences.chinese: 紹興酒屬米酒類，品之香味誘人，有點象日本的清酒。

sentences.english: Shaoxing wine is a sort of rice wine, it is attractive by fragrant , like the Qing wine in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 紹興酒屬米酒類，品之香味誘人，有點象日本的清酒。

definition: (of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
